intro: Monnina tenuifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf monnina, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant features slender, branching stems covered with small, alternate leaves that are typically lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense spikes, producing a distinctive pinkish to reddish color. Monnina tenuifolia is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
